positive.review:
It's one of my favourite mobile clickers, BUT, it's a direct port from mobile. They're shipping the exact same game as the copy from the Google Playstore. 

While I don't have an issue with this, some might find it lazy when they find the AFK mode in the settings (which dims your PC and prevents the PC monitor from going to sleep), or the insistence of tapping everywhere instead of clicking. 

The only reason I can think of for this to be the case, is so that the in-game store works across desktop and mobile. That being said, the store is disabled by default on PC, and when you stumble on the store for the first time, a statement pops up saying the entire game can be beaten without microtransactions. 

It's still a really fun incremental clicker. Give it a go, you've got nothing to lose with this one.

Its free. but its not idle. no offline time so you will have leave game running which consumes power and makes air smell bad from the electronic device working. basicaly playable only with autoclicker. some offline time can be purchased with gems but its in the amount of minutes.
Awesome idle game, tons of content, many hours of satisfying gameplay
Pretty graphics with a good gameplay loop.

Very fun idle game. Especially good as the game is free. 

Good upgrade path and generally a well thought out game. There is a shop, but all upgrades can be got in game, so no need to spend money if you do not want. 

Would highly recommend.
Easy to check in on each day and keep consistent progress on.
Playing this game is a life changing experience
its just so fucking good
iz gud. I like dig.
ok

I will leave the cat here, so that everybody who passes by can pet it and give it a thumbs up and awards.

This one is an absolute gem.

I play A LOT of incrementals, idlers and so on and most of them fall flat very quickly.

This one keeps introducing fun new mechanics and playstyles though, there's a lot to collect and grind up to and if you're like me and not above a bit of autoclicking+cheat engine, it's doable in a reasonable amount of time :)


(Be warned, though - playing this by hand would be insanity and if you don't use CE at all, you might be working on this for a LONG time.)
Great little idle game. I love having games like this on in the background when I'm studying and this game seems to find a nice balance between interaction and idle
Used to play this a lot on mobile. Just started on PC. Steam version is a different kind of fun. Give it a try.

Its free. but its not idle. no offline time so you will have leave game running which consumes power and makes air smell bad from the electronic device working. basicaly playable only with autoclicker. some offline time can be purchased with gems but its in the amount of minutes.

Starts off nicely, but falls down after. I reached floor 1,000 on all mines, which is presumably the end goal of the game. But it got a little bland rather quickly after the beginning. I suppose the lovely art style kept it alive for me. The achievement for leveling 20 miners to max level is extremely tedious and boring. Huge plus to the developer for initially disabling the in-game store and making the premium resource farmable.

It's one of my favourite mobile clickers, BUT, it's a direct port from mobile. They're shipping the exact same game as the copy from the Google Playstore. 

While I don't have an issue with this, some might find it lazy when they find the AFK mode in the settings (which dims your PC and prevents the PC monitor from going to sleep), or the insistence of tapping everywhere instead of clicking. 

The only reason I can think of for this to be the case, is so that the in-game store works across desktop and mobile. That being said, the store is disabled by default on PC, and when you stumble on the store for the first time, a statement pops up saying the entire game can be beaten without microtransactions. 

It's still a really fun incremental clicker. Give it a go, you've got nothing to lose with this one.
Awesome idle game, tons of content, many hours of satisfying gameplay
Pretty graphics with a good gameplay loop.

Very fun idle game. Especially good as the game is free. 

Good upgrade path and generally a well thought out game. There is a shop, but all upgrades can be got in game, so no need to spend money if you do not want. 

Would highly recommend.
Oh boy, I can't wait to see this second miner in action, the cleaning will be so much fas... he pulled a fricking shotgun and destroyed three blocks with one blast. 10/10 game.

Fun little idle game! I enjoy the simple progression and resource management. It's satisfying to see your mining operation slowly grow and become more efficient. A good choice for some casual gaming when you have a few minutes.

This game has a nice art style and is a decent time killer. Has paid options but you CAN max everything out for free through sheer patience. I like that it also syncs to mobile. That being said if you aim to 100% this game for free - it will take a while.

This game does things well. I dont often find a nice idle game that keeps me interested for a longer while. This one does. You get to mine in several caves in somewhat parallel, so theres multiple progressions going on. There is always stuff to do, minerals to forge, things to level up, miners to unlock and upgrade. Prestige is doable quickly enough to keep things moving. It will get grindy at some point, looking at the prices of stuff going up. But its really great fun so far.

First, this game is free. It shouldn't be because it's a great game and worth a few dollars at least. A highly addictive incremental that lets you upgrade and make your way through mines. It's just plain fun. Worth a try. I mean come on, It's free!

best game i have ever played, i get cancer from actually playing this hot piece of idle game, this is the only thing keeping my sanity safe in the school hours, i wish i could explain how much i love this game but then this would turn into paragraph long text.

elton

It's a fun game, but insanely grindy towards the end. i'm hoping the coming sequel makes it more like Revolution Idle in the vein that it's relatively grindy, but all throughout there's always some small avenue of constant progress that requires game knowledge to know it, leading new players to pad it more, but experienced players able to comparatively breeze through.
I just wish worlds would progress their floors while offline. It would improve the game tremendously.

Idle Cave Miner is an idle game about crafting items, mining gems, and building your team of miners. Prestige, craft, and travel to other mines to increase your strength to dig deeper, and find what lurks below.
Easy to check in on each day and keep consistent progress on.
Simple but addictive - dig, upgrade, repeat

Interesting 8 bit graphics or maybe 16 idk but very nostalgic for me. It's nice to be able to go to different "caves" and mine for various ores, and raw materials. To which then you are able to craft other items to be able to increase your abilities like, mining power, tap damage, and more. On the PC game you can only claim a single amount of resources when you are away from the game. BUT if you download the mobile version you can then get 2x the resources. Make sure you use the cloud save before going to mobile. You can also get up to 10 birds vs PC version is only 5.
I will agree with a couple of other reviews where mid to late game it becomes a crawl. A snails pace. A tortoise and hare but you are the tortoise (but you never win the game). It is a FREE to Play but PAY to win type of game. Gems can help you out in the short run but then they become scarce. 
The fun part I have found so far is wasting a few hours just clicking or tapping the mouse button.  I see a version 2 is coming soon maybe the game play will be better. I am only recommending the game because it is free and it does have some fun to it.
Playing this game is a life changing experience
its just so fucking good
Good game had a lot of fun
best game since 2021
Fun fun cool
Cute little game.
Very fun game!
Pretty fun
I am not a dwarf but I would dig a hole
idling in my cave, minemaxxing
iz gud. I like dig.
Can see your legs.
High play!
Me gusto
spoko idle na pare godzinek
its alright
Love it!
fun to have in the background
Good.
slow.........very slow
ok

negative.review:
A lot of the upgrades require actual cash to get and can't be unlocked through any form of play.

In fact MOST of the upgrades, like auto-click, require cash.

So of the 8 upgrades you can only get with cash, it is $45 if you buy the "discounted bundles."

If the maker had a price closer to $20 for the upgrades that made the game faster, and made the auto-click able to be purchased without cash I wouldn't mind.

Unfortunately due to the game having basically 0 content outside of clicking for upgrades and waiting it is a big thumbs down.

not much to say, mobile grinding game with trash interface. 

there's a cool game underneath that interface but unfortunately mobile grinding game also has trash artificial inconvenience system to push you towards a cash shop.

Game has stellar pixel graphics and the early game progression is charming.
However mid to late game progression comes to a crawl. The store purchasable items feel necessary to play. 
Premium in game currency costs grow exponentially while providing miniscule rewards and at the same time the supply is capped to around 600 a day. With heavy emphasis on the player having to grind for it.
The UI is cumbersome at times (some QoL upgrades like toggle to hide maxed upgrades would be welcome).

A lot of the upgrades require actual cash to get and can't be unlocked through any form of play.

In fact MOST of the upgrades, like auto-click, require cash.

So of the 8 upgrades you can only get with cash, it is $45 if you buy the "discounted bundles."

If the maker had a price closer to $20 for the upgrades that made the game faster, and made the auto-click able to be purchased without cash I wouldn't mind.

Unfortunately due to the game having basically 0 content outside of clicking for upgrades and waiting it is a big thumbs down.

This game is insanely slow without auto clicker.
After 30h i unlocked everything and the game is very grinding on higher levels, you can easily spend your first week on gems for reducing crafting time on your Forges and it still seems very slow.  Now i need to farm Mythic gem, i get 1 every 1:08 min and i need 5k+ to progess, i can easily spend 20k if i had them, that's 3,85 days. now i have to wait half a week just to progress some after only 30h play time. Too slow progress for the amount of grind time compared to other idle games.
They made a legendary status on discord for not using auto clicker, like i will punish myself for some stupid tag. Not worth it over auto clicker

not much to say, mobile grinding game with trash interface. 

there's a cool game underneath that interface but unfortunately mobile grinding game also has trash artificial inconvenience system to push you towards a cash shop.

Exceedingly grindy, extremely shallow upgrade system and therefore boring progression loop, heavily balanced around paid upgrades.

Seems like a sorry excuse for you to spend money.

Je reprocherai au jeu un end game totalement absent, tout est bouclé assez rapidement en une centaine d'heure grand max, après c'est juste un long grind sans intérêt ni variation de quelques centaines d'heures supplémentaires si vous voulez atteindre 100% de succès pour monter au niveau max 15 mineurs que vous n'utiliserez de toute façon jamais puisqu'il n'y a rien à faire au delà de la zone 1000. Ça ne me donne pas envie de remettre le couvert pour le 2.

Avant cela, le jeu fait son taf. Bref, je suis vraiment mitigé.

I don't think i would recommend anyone playing it, but I am still continuing my playthrough. 

TLDR Play something else probably

Another pseudo incremental game that gameplay is linear. Progress is quite bonded with a premium currency. Squeezing birds(provides you a daily premium currency) isn't automated, and you need to spend money to double it.

[h2]TL;DR[/h2]
Recommended if you don't care about full completion, otherwise be prepared for [b]grind[/b].

[h2]Good parts[/h2]
Idle Cave Miner is quite nice for most part. The multiple-world mechanic with "simultaneous" progression introduces a somewhat-fresh spin. Gameplay elements are easy to understand, but have an interesting depth, with many dimensions to them. Getting to 1000 floors is not [i]that[/i] hard, so "finishing" the game can be done reasonably. If you don't care about 100% achievements or Abyss, then this is a fine game to spend some time on.

However, there are many things which led me to give this a thumbs-down.

[h2]Why I don't recommend it[/h2]
[i]Disclaimer:[/i] I'm not an avid fan of grindy games.

[b]Abyss[/b]
A new area that presents a fresh, new playstyle, with many unique features and rewards. The problem? It comes very late, while being ridiculously slow to progress, making it painful and [i]useless[/i]. Maybe it's intended for going really deep, but why bother? There is nothing there.
(I have to mention this somewhere: "increase initial floor" stat makes it harder to prestige. I lamented the fact I bought it all.)

[b]Miners[/b]
There are problems with both miners themselves and miners screen. Miners are not equal. That would be alright, but it is often unclear if a given one is good or not. There are prices, which help sometimes, but it's mostly upgrades's prices that show quality, and you need to buy miners first. Which you will do anyway for achievements. Oh, and overall power, which is hidden under the list of miners. And this leads me to the second point...
The miners screen sucks. Stats barely matter, because nothing shows attack patterns, except, sometimes, text descriptions. And patterns change from upgrades on some miners, but not all, and nothing tells you that! At the same time, attack patterns are included in intended strength of a miner, while in practice many of them underperform due to going for lone blocks. This is needlessly annoying. (Use Franky, don't bother with Mike, he is too slow.)
Oh, and special abilities to get more stuff? Yeah, forget about them, chance is too low to matter.
Also, skins. Prices for them are wild. Some of them are like, 10k iron, and some cost millions. Why does Anne's ghost skin cost [b]so[/b] much? It's cool, but it's just a skin. And many skins cost premium currency, making them needlessly hard to get.

[b]Exponential grind[/b]
While most of the game is fine, it goes not for exponential growth of numbers, but for exponential growth of grinding (sadly, the norm for the genre, I suppose), making tail-end of it very bad. If you value your time and sanity, use at least an autoclicker.

But what really made me write this review is premium currency. You need at least 2000 to buy miners for the "20 bought miners" achivement (Rick doesn't count). It's not like there isn't enough, but by the time you get there, you already spent it on other things, forcing you to do the stupid daily quests. Preferably by changing dates. Oh, and you can't get new quests for the same date, because for some reason game stores which exact quests for which dates you already did (or something like that). And you can't manipulate memory to get more currency, because it's obfuscated in some way (probably because it's [i]premium[/i]). Sitting there with 4 quests to tap birds is maddening.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
Play with an autoclicker. When grind gets bad, cheat, it's fine. Your time is more important than some misplaced sense of pride and accomplishment. And save the premium currency for at least two premium miners to get the achievement.

At the end, Idle Cave Miner left a bad aftertaste. I liked it at the start, though.
ultra grindy and becomes a boring grind end game 5/10
very bland
nope

Game has stellar pixel graphics and the early game progression is charming.
However mid to late game progression comes to a crawl. The store purchasable items feel necessary to play. 
Premium in game currency costs grow exponentially while providing miniscule rewards and at the same time the supply is capped to around 600 a day. With heavy emphasis on the player having to grind for it.
The UI is cumbersome at times (some QoL upgrades like toggle to hide maxed upgrades would be welcome).

A lot of the upgrades require actual cash to get and can't be unlocked through any form of play.

In fact MOST of the upgrades, like auto-click, require cash.

So of the 8 upgrades you can only get with cash, it is $45 if you buy the "discounted bundles."

If the maker had a price closer to $20 for the upgrades that made the game faster, and made the auto-click able to be purchased without cash I wouldn't mind.

Unfortunately due to the game having basically 0 content outside of clicking for upgrades and waiting it is a big thumbs down.

This game is insanely slow without auto clicker.
After 30h i unlocked everything and the game is very grinding on higher levels, you can easily spend your first week on gems for reducing crafting time on your Forges and it still seems very slow.  Now i need to farm Mythic gem, i get 1 every 1:08 min and i need 5k+ to progess, i can easily spend 20k if i had them, that's 3,85 days. now i have to wait half a week just to progress some after only 30h play time. Too slow progress for the amount of grind time compared to other idle games.
They made a legendary status on discord for not using auto clicker, like i will punish myself for some stupid tag. Not worth it over auto clicker

not much to say, mobile grinding game with trash interface. 

there's a cool game underneath that interface but unfortunately mobile grinding game also has trash artificial inconvenience system to push you towards a cash shop.

Exceedingly grindy, extremely shallow upgrade system and therefore boring progression loop, heavily balanced around paid upgrades.

Seems like a sorry excuse for you to spend money.

Je reprocherai au jeu un end game totalement absent, tout est bouclé assez rapidement en une centaine d'heure grand max, après c'est juste un long grind sans intérêt ni variation de quelques centaines d'heures supplémentaires si vous voulez atteindre 100% de succès pour monter au niveau max 15 mineurs que vous n'utiliserez de toute façon jamais puisqu'il n'y a rien à faire au delà de la zone 1000. Ça ne me donne pas envie de remettre le couvert pour le 2.

Avant cela, le jeu fait son taf. Bref, je suis vraiment mitigé.

I don't think i would recommend anyone playing it, but I am still continuing my playthrough. 

TLDR Play something else probably

Another pseudo incremental game that gameplay is linear. Progress is quite bonded with a premium currency. Squeezing birds(provides you a daily premium currency) isn't automated, and you need to spend money to double it.

[h2]TL;DR[/h2]
Recommended if you don't care about full completion, otherwise be prepared for [b]grind[/b].

[h2]Good parts[/h2]
Idle Cave Miner is quite nice for most part. The multiple-world mechanic with "simultaneous" progression introduces a somewhat-fresh spin. Gameplay elements are easy to understand, but have an interesting depth, with many dimensions to them. Getting to 1000 floors is not [i]that[/i] hard, so "finishing" the game can be done reasonably. If you don't care about 100% achievements or Abyss, then this is a fine game to spend some time on.

However, there are many things which led me to give this a thumbs-down.

[h2]Why I don't recommend it[/h2]
[i]Disclaimer:[/i] I'm not an avid fan of grindy games.

[b]Abyss[/b]
A new area that presents a fresh, new playstyle, with many unique features and rewards. The problem? It comes very late, while being ridiculously slow to progress, making it painful and [i]useless[/i]. Maybe it's intended for going really deep, but why bother? There is nothing there.
(I have to mention this somewhere: "increase initial floor" stat makes it harder to prestige. I lamented the fact I bought it all.)

[b]Miners[/b]
There are problems with both miners themselves and miners screen. Miners are not equal. That would be alright, but it is often unclear if a given one is good or not. There are prices, which help sometimes, but it's mostly upgrades's prices that show quality, and you need to buy miners first. Which you will do anyway for achievements. Oh, and overall power, which is hidden under the list of miners. And this leads me to the second point...
The miners screen sucks. Stats barely matter, because nothing shows attack patterns, except, sometimes, text descriptions. And patterns change from upgrades on some miners, but not all, and nothing tells you that! At the same time, attack patterns are included in intended strength of a miner, while in practice many of them underperform due to going for lone blocks. This is needlessly annoying. (Use Franky, don't bother with Mike, he is too slow.)
Oh, and special abilities to get more stuff? Yeah, forget about them, chance is too low to matter.
Also, skins. Prices for them are wild. Some of them are like, 10k iron, and some cost millions. Why does Anne's ghost skin cost [b]so[/b] much? It's cool, but it's just a skin. And many skins cost premium currency, making them needlessly hard to get.

[b]Exponential grind[/b]
While most of the game is fine, it goes not for exponential growth of numbers, but for exponential growth of grinding (sadly, the norm for the genre, I suppose), making tail-end of it very bad. If you value your time and sanity, use at least an autoclicker.

But what really made me write this review is premium currency. You need at least 2000 to buy miners for the "20 bought miners" achivement (Rick doesn't count). It's not like there isn't enough, but by the time you get there, you already spent it on other things, forcing you to do the stupid daily quests. Preferably by changing dates. Oh, and you can't get new quests for the same date, because for some reason game stores which exact quests for which dates you already did (or something like that). And you can't manipulate memory to get more currency, because it's obfuscated in some way (probably because it's [i]premium[/i]). Sitting there with 4 quests to tap birds is maddening.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
Play with an autoclicker. When grind gets bad, cheat, it's fine. Your time is more important than some misplaced sense of pride and accomplishment. And save the premium currency for at least two premium miners to get the achievement.

At the end, Idle Cave Miner left a bad aftertaste. I liked it at the start, though.
ultra grindy and becomes a boring grind end game 5/10
very bland
nope

Premium in game currency costs grow exponentially while providing miniscule rewards and at the same time the supply is capped to around 600 a day. With heavy emphasis on the player having to grind for it.
The UI is cumbersome at times (some QoL upgrades like toggle to hide maxed upgrades would be welcome).

At the same time, attack patterns are included in intended strength of a miner, while in practice many of them underperform due to going for lone blocks. This is needlessly annoying. (Use Franky, don't bother with Mike, he is too slow.)
Oh, and special abilities to get more stuff? Yeah, forget about them, chance is too low to matter.
Also, skins. Prices for them are wild. Some of them are like, 10k iron, and some cost millions. Why does Anne's ghost skin cost [b]so[/b] much? It's cool, but it's just a skin. And many skins cost premium currency, making them needlessly hard to get.

[b]Exponential grind[/b]
While most of the game is fine, it goes not for exponential growth of numbers, but for exponential growth of grinding (sadly, the norm for the genre, I suppose), making tail-end of it very bad. If you value your time and sanity, use at least an autoclicker.

But what really made me write this review is premium currency. You need at least 2000 to buy miners for the "20 bought miners" achivement (Rick doesn't count). It's not like there isn't enough, but by the time you get there, you already spent it on other things, forcing you to do the stupid daily quests. Preferably by changing dates. Oh, and you can't get new quests for the same date, because for some reason game stores which exact quests for which dates you already did (or something like that). And you can't manipulate memory to get more currency, because it's obfuscated in some way (probably because it's [i]premium[/i]). Sitting there with 4 quests to tap birds is maddening.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
Play with an autoclicker. When grind gets bad, cheat, it's fine. Your time is more important than some misplaced sense of pride and accomplishment. And save the premium currency for at least two premium miners to get the achievement.

At the end, Idle Cave Miner left a bad aftertaste. I liked it at the start, though.
ultra grindy and becomes a boring grind end game 5/10
very bland
nope

Game has stellar pixel graphics and the early game progression is charming.
However mid to late game progression comes to a crawl. The store purchasable items feel necessary to play. 
Premium in game currency costs grow exponentially while providing miniscule rewards and at the same time the supply is capped to around 600 a day. With heavy emphasis on the player having to grind for it.
The UI is cumbersome at times (some QoL upgrades like toggle to hide maxed upgrades would be welcome).

A lot of the upgrades require actual cash to get and can't be unlocked through any form of play.

In fact MOST of the upgrades, like auto-click, require cash.

So of the 8 upgrades you can only get with cash, it is $45 if you buy the "discounted bundles."

If the maker had a price closer to $20 for the upgrades that made the game faster, and made the auto-click able to be purchased without cash I wouldn't mind.

Unfortunately due to the game having basically 0 content outside of clicking for upgrades and waiting it is a big thumbs down.

This game is insanely slow without auto clicker.
After 30h i unlocked everything and the game is very grinding on higher levels, you can easily spend your first week on gems for reducing crafting time on your Forges and it still seems very slow.  Now i need to farm Mythic gem, i get 1 every 1:08 min and i need 5k+ to progess, i can easily spend 20k if i had them, that's 3,85 days. now i have to wait half a week just to progress some after only 30h play time. Too slow progress for the amount of grind time compared to other idle games.
They made a legendary status on discord for not using auto clicker, like i will punish myself for some stupid tag. Not worth it over auto clicker

not much to say, mobile grinding game with trash interface. 

there's a cool game underneath that interface but unfortunately mobile grinding game also has trash artificial inconvenience system to push you towards a cash shop.

Exceedingly grindy, extremely shallow upgrade system and therefore boring progression loop, heavily balanced around paid upgrades.

Seems like a sorry excuse for you to spend money.

Je reprocherai au jeu un end game totalement absent, tout est bouclé assez rapidement en une centaine d'heure grand max, après c'est juste un long grind sans intérêt ni variation de quelques centaines d'heures supplémentaires si vous voulez atteindre 100% de succès pour monter au niveau max 15 mineurs que vous n'utiliserez de toute façon jamais puisqu'il n'y a rien à faire au delà de la zone 1000. Ça ne me donne pas envie de remettre le couvert pour le 2.

Avant cela, le jeu fait son taf. Bref, je suis vraiment mitigé.

I don't think i would recommend anyone playing it, but I am still continuing my playthrough. 

TLDR Play something else probably

Another pseudo incremental game that gameplay is linear. Progress is quite bonded with a premium currency. Squeezing birds(provides you a daily premium currency) isn't automated, and you need to spend money to double it.

[h2]TL;DR[/h2]
Recommended if you don't care about full completion, otherwise be prepared for [b]grind[/b].

[h2]Good parts[/h2]
Idle Cave Miner is quite nice for most part. The multiple-world mechanic with "simultaneous" progression introduces a somewhat-fresh spin. Gameplay elements are easy to understand, but have an interesting depth, with many dimensions to them. Getting to 1000 floors is not [i]that[/i] hard, so "finishing" the game can be done reasonably. If you don't care about 100% achievements or Abyss, then this is a fine game to spend some time on.

However, there are many things which led me to give this a thumbs-down.

[h2]Why I don't recommend it[/h2]
[i]Disclaimer:[/i] I'm not an avid fan of grindy games.

[b]Abyss[/b]
A new area that presents a fresh, new playstyle, with many unique features and rewards. The problem? It comes very late, while being ridiculously slow to progress, making it painful and [i]useless[/i]. Maybe it's intended for going really deep, but why bother? There is nothing there.
(I have to mention this somewhere: "increase initial floor" stat makes it harder to prestige. I lamented the fact I bought it all.)

[b]Miners[/b]
There are problems with both miners themselves and miners screen. Miners are not equal. That would be alright, but it is often unclear if a given one is good or not. There are prices, which help sometimes, but it's mostly upgrades's prices that show quality, and you need to buy miners first. Which you will do anyway for achievements. Oh, and overall power, which is hidden under the list of miners. And this leads me to the second point...
The miners screen sucks. Stats barely matter, because nothing shows attack patterns, except, sometimes, text descriptions. And patterns change from upgrades on some miners, but not all, and nothing tells you that! At the same time, attack patterns are included in intended strength of a miner, while in practice many of them underperform due to going for lone blocks. This is needlessly annoying. (Use Franky, don't bother with Mike, he is too slow.)
Oh, and special abilities to get more stuff? Yeah, forget about them, chance is too low to matter.
Also, skins. Prices for them are wild. Some of them are like, 10k iron, and some cost millions. Why does Anne's ghost skin cost [b]so[/b] much? It's cool, but it's just a skin. And many skins cost premium currency, making them needlessly hard to get.

[b]Exponential grind[/b]
While most of the game is fine, it goes not for exponential growth of numbers, but for exponential growth of grinding (sadly, the norm for the genre, I suppose), making tail-end of it very bad. If you value your time and sanity, use at least an autoclicker.

But what really made me write this review is premium currency. You need at least 2000 to buy miners for the "20 bought miners" achivement (Rick doesn't count). It's not like there isn't enough, but by the time you get there, you already spent it on other things, forcing you to do the stupid daily quests. Preferably by changing dates. Oh, and you can't get new quests for the same date, because for some reason game stores which exact quests for which dates you already did (or something like that). And you can't manipulate memory to get more currency, because it's obfuscated in some way (probably because it's [i]premium[/i]). Sitting there with 4 quests to tap birds is maddening.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
Play with an autoclicker. When grind gets bad, cheat, it's fine. Your time is more important than some misplaced sense of pride and accomplishment. And save the premium currency for at least two premium miners to get the achievement.

At the end, Idle Cave Miner left a bad aftertaste. I liked it at the start, though.
